EmailTemplate.name: OSS_Email_Spring_Newsletter_2018.Spring_Newsletter_Email_December_2018
EmailTemplate.subject: This Month in Spring
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
December 2018 Hi, Spring fans! Welcome to another jam-packed This Month in Spring! Happy holidays to you and yours! It's also the busy end-of-conference season, with people all around the world getting in their last-minute learning before the new year—and, at least for some, before the training budgets run out!
I've been keeping busy. Since we last talked a month ago, I've been to Morocco, Switzerland, France, Italy, Hong Kong, Taiwan, China, Japan, South Korea, Singapore, Los Angeles, and possibly—though memory fails me—Connecticut. You know what's been common to all those visits? Amazing people! The most bootiful people in the world.
I'll be in Toronto and Seattle and then, I think, I'll be winding down for the year starting the middle of this month. But, not to worry: even if we can't meet in person until 2019, there's always more things and more Springs for the season. The first episode of the 5th season of Spring Tips <[[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MTKlk8_9aAw&list=PLgGXSWYM2FpPw8rV0tZoMiJYSCiLhPnOc]]> just debuted on the Spring blog <[[https://spring.io/blog]]>, and will continue each Wednesday for the next 11 weeks. I'll of course be doing weekly installments of This Week in Spring—we’re going into our 8th year in the first week of January—which runs every Tuesday on the Spring blog as well. I'll also be working fast and furious on my new book, Reactive Spring <[[http://www.reactivespring.io/]]>, coming soon! And, finally, this month I'll be releasing the first episodes of a A Bootiful Podcast <[[https://twitter.com/BootifulPodcast]]>, a new podcast on which I've long been toiling. You can find it—guess where—on the Spring blog! So: watch that space.
That's all from me! Let's get to the good stuff, the reason for the (Spring) season, all the great content from you and the ecosystems around Spring. And, there is a ton of content!
The Long and short of it <[[https://content.pivotal.io/cloud-native-josh-long/this-month-in-spring-december-2-2019?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-december-2018]]>
SpringOne Tour Heads to Toronto
As 2018 comes to a close, the SpringOne Tour bus will make its final stop for the year! The tour rolls in to Toronto <[[https://springonetour.io/2018/toronto?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-december-2018]]> December 12. Visit our tour page <[[https://springonetour.io/?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-december-2018]]> and we hope to see you at a future stop.
Reserve your seat <[[https://2018.event.springonetour.io/register/registration/select?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-december-2018]]>
SpringOne Platform 2019 in Austin
Be sure to save the date for SpringOne Platform 2019, October 7–10, in Austin, Texas.
Sign up to stay informed <[[https://springoneplatform.io/?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-december-2018]]>
Links Spring Eternal
Webinar [Thursday, December 13]:
Chaos Engineering in a World of Distributed Spring Boot Apps <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars/dec-13-chaos-engineering-in-a-world-of-distributed-spring-boot-apps-webinar?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=webinar&utm_campaign=chaos-spring-cloud-boot&utm_term=q418]]>

<[[https://spring.io/blog/2018/11/29/spring-security-5-1-2-5-0-10-4-2-10-released?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-december-2018]]>Spring Security 5.1.2, 5.0.10, and 4.2.10 released <[[https://spring.io/blog/2018/11/29/spring-security-5-1-2-5-0-10-4-2-10-released?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-december-2018]]>
Spring Boot 1.5.18 available now <[[https://spring.io/blog/2018/11/29/spring-boot-1-5-18-available-now?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-december-2018]]>
Spring Data Lovelace SR3, Kay SR12, and Ingalls SR17 released <[[https://spring.io/blog/2018/11/27/spring-data-lovelace-sr3-kay-sr12-and-ingalls-sr17-released?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-december-2018]]>
Spring Framework 5.1.3, 5.0.11, and 4.3.21 available now <[[https://spring.io/blog/2018/11/27/spring-framework-5-1-3-5-0-11-and-4-3-21-available-now?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-december-2018]]>
Visit our blog for even more Spring and Spring-adjacent content <[[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kE3lTlPwykE]]>.
I want to go to there <[[https://spring.io/?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-december-2018]]>
